alert.note: Alert for Central St. Louis; North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 29 at 10:33AM CDT until May 29 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: .Relative humidity in far northeast Minnesota has mixed out into the mid-20 percent range as of 1030 CDT this morning, and is expected to further decrease this afternoon. Southerly winds also increase this afternoon, gusting to 20 mph. These conditions will combine with the ongoing dry fuels, per local land agencies, to create areas of critical fire weather conditions. Relative humidity is expected to begin to recover around 2000 CDT this evening as dewpoints begin to increase ahead of chances for rain and thunderstorms building over the Arrowhead by Tuesday. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY SOUTHERLY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR CENTRAL AND NORTHERN ST. LOUIS COUNTY AND NORTHERN COOK AND NORTHERN LAKE COUNTIES... The National Weather Service in Duluth has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty southerly winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect until 8 PM CDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...In Northeast Minnesota, central and northern St. Louis, northern Cook and northern Lake Counties. * WINDS...South to southeast 10 to 15 mph with gusts to 20 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 20 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires may grow and spread quickly.
info.instruction: This Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are expected by this afternoon. A combination of gusty southerly winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Central St. Louis; North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake
